newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan stocks end lower, profit-taking continues.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan stocks end lower, profit-taking continues.

text.p: Taiwan share prices closed slightly lower on Saturday with investors continuing to take profits amid cautious market sentiment, brokers said.
The weighted index ended down 24.28 points or 0.29 percent at 8,302.25. Turnover was a brisk T$93.48 billion in Saturday's shortened session.
The market, buoyed by expectations of continued economic recovery, has added a hefty 25 percent in 1997 alone by April 14. But it has eased by more than 300 points in its past five sessions.
"There was no further bearish news today, just that investors have turned cautious in general," said Joe Chiou, analyst for Taiwan Securities Investment.
The profit-taking spree was exacerbated by a government announcement on April 16 that it planned to speed up a selldown of equity in various listed state firms.
Saturday's loss came despite the heavily weighted financials launching a rebound of 1.34 percent.
Brokers expected the index to consolidate at current levels on Monday. A 8,250-8,350 range was seen.
